Title.evidence: This study aimed to explore the clinical presentation and outcomes of NSTI in patients with advanced malignancies, focusing on diagnostic challenges and management strategies.

Trial_Design.evidence: No randomization, blinding, or sample size calculation was applicable as this was a single case report.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to explore the clinical presentation and outcomes of NSTI in patients with advanced malignancies, focusing on diagnostic challenges and management strategies.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the time to progression to septic shock, measured from the onset of symptoms.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: No randomization, blinding, or sample size calculation was applicable as this was a single case report.

Blinding.evidence: No randomization, blinding, or sample size calculation was applicable as this was a single case report.

Number_Randomised.evidence: No randomization, blinding, or sample size calculation was applicable as this was a single case report.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Blood cultures revealed Clostridium septicum and Staphylococcus epidermidis, the latter considered a contaminant.

Harms.evidence: The patient rapidly progressed to septic shock and died within 34 hours of presentation.
